whatIs.title: ¿Qué es el Tratamiento de Artrosis y cómo funciona?
whatIs.definition: La artrosis es una enfermedad degenerativa de las articulaciones que causa dolor, inflamación y limitación del movimiento. Nuestro tratamiento utiliza técnicas regenerativas avanzadas para estimular la reparación del cartílago y reducir la inflamación.
whatIs.physiologicalBenefit: Los tratamientos regenerativos para artrosis trabajan estimulando los mecanismos naturales de curación del cuerpo. Utilizamos factores de crecimiento y células madre para promover la regeneración del tejido cartilaginoso, reducir la inflamación y mejorar la lubricación articular.
whatIs.howWorks: El procedimiento consiste en la aplicación de terapias biológicas directamente en la articulación afectada, utilizando ultrasonido para máxima precisión. Estas sustancias estimulan la reparación del tejido dañado y reducen el proceso inflamatorio, aliviando el dolor y mejorando la función articular.

whatIs.title: What is Arthritis Treatment and how does it work?
whatIs.definition: Arthritis is a degenerative joint disease that causes pain, inflammation, and limited movement. Our treatment uses advanced regenerative techniques to stimulate cartilage repair and reduce inflammation.
whatIs.physiologicalBenefit: Regenerative treatments for arthritis work by stimulating the body's natural healing mechanisms. We use growth factors and stem cells to promote cartilage tissue regeneration, reduce inflammation, and improve joint lubrication.
whatIs.howWorks: The procedure consists of applying biological therapies directly to the affected joint, using ultrasound for maximum precision. These substances stimulate the repair of damaged tissue and reduce the inflammatory process, relieving pain and improving joint function.

items.title: Pain Reduction
items.description: Most patients experience significant pain relief within the first 2-4 weeks.

items.title: Improved Mobility
items.description: Notable increase in range of motion and ability to perform daily activities.

items.title: Avoid Surgery
items.description: Many patients can avoid or postpone joint replacement surgeries.

steps.title: Diagnostic Evaluation
steps.description: We perform a complete examination with high-resolution ultrasound to assess the degree of joint damage and design the best treatment plan for you.

steps.title: Treatment Application
steps.description: Minimally invasive procedure guided by ultrasound. The treatment takes approximately 30-45 minutes and you can go home the same day.

steps.title: Follow-up and Recovery
steps.description: Personalized rehabilitation program with regular check-ups to monitor your progress and optimize results.

faqs.q: How long does the treatment take?
faqs.a: The procedure itself takes between 30-45 minutes. Depending on your case, 1-3 sessions spaced every 4-6 weeks may be necessary.
It is performed with local anesthesia, so discomfort is minimal. Some patients report mild tenderness for 2-3 days after the procedure.
Most patients begin to experience improvement between 2-4 weeks after treatment, with optimal results at 2-3 months.

faqs.q: How long do the results last?
faqs.a: Results can last 1-2 years or more, depending on the degree of arthritis and post-treatment care. Many patients opt for maintenance sessions.

faqs.q: Can I return to my normal activities?
faqs.a: Yes, most patients can resume light activities within 24-48 hours. It is recommended to avoid intense exercise for 1-2 weeks.
